# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

None.

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString; text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    for word in split(text, " ")
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width  # Account for space after the word
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
        current_line *= word * " "
    end
    if current_line != ""
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end
    return join(lines, "\n")  # Join the lines with new line characters
end

# Example usage:
text = "Hello there! This is a very long sentence that should be wrapped to fit within 10 characters per line."
println(wrap_string(text))
```

This function splits the text into words using `split`, then iterates over each word, appending it to the current line. If the length of the current line plus the word exceeds the specified `text_width` (10 by default), a new line is started. The final result is a string with each line containing no more than `text_width` characters.
